Larry Ellison, the return of Silicon Valley's big spender
description: At 80, Oracle's founder – one of the world's wealthiest executives and an eccentric figurehead of the 2000s – has returned to the spotlight thanks to Donald Trump. He is a contender to buy TikTok and has begun capitalizing on the enormous contracts for artificial intelligence data centers.

Texas in shock after fatal flood kills over 50 people with dozens missing
description: Fifteen children are among the dead after the flooding of the Guadalupe River struck a popular tourist region. Dozens more girls attending a summer camp are reported missing.

headline: Israeli negotiators due in Qatar for Gaza truce talks
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is due to meet on Monday with US President Donald Trump, who has been making a renewed push to end the fighting.

headline: Paris shuts Seine swim spots day after reopening due to rain
description: The iconic river reopened to the public for the first time in a century on Saturday, but was closed for swimming one day later after rainfall.

headline: Iranian photographer Forough Alaei portrays life during the war: 'Nothing will ever be the same again'
description: After the first Israeli bombings in Iran, Iranian photographer Forough Alaei left Tehran to take refuge with her family on the Caspian Sea coast. She documented those days when war plunged them into the unknown.

description: Sonia C. was still a law enforcement officer when, in April 2024, she was sentenced to three years in prison for handing police files to an informant known as the Jackal. Naivety still marks this former officer, who loved to party until dawn and used cocaine.

headline: 'Art brut' to the point of saturation at the Grand Palais
description: Although overly dense and insufficiently documented, the exhibition of part of Bruno Decharme's donation, presented by the Centre Pompidou, contains some important pieces of outsider art.

headline: In France, asylum seekers navigate labyrinth of Europe's Dublin Regulation
description: '2015-2025: Europe's migration crisis' (3/5). In the 1990s, the European Union established the Dublin Regulation, aiming to prevent asylum seekers from filing applications in multiple countries. The massive influx of refugees over the past 10 years has shattered the system, which is no longer implemented in all EU member states.
